titleStmt.title: Michael H. Owsley to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG4618

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
A forfeiture was obtained at the present term of the Boyle Circuit Court Court against Ed Mitchell for $100- for issuing a policy and taking risks as an agent for the London & Liverpool insurance Company without license. Mr. M had obtained the mandatory license and paid the tax but failed to return a copy to the office here. My habit is where the law is violated however unintentional to dismiss no case but the matter for excute executive clemency I have no hesitancy when I
am satisfied the state of facts merit it to make the application request of I dont believe Mr Mitchell intended to violate the law and therefore address you on the subject --
I am allright yet leaving Frankfort and feel very much like a gentleman.
